documents.document: "You have brains in your head. Your feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself in any direction you choose." - Dr. Seuss
"Our aspirations are our possibilities." - Robert Browning
"Be not simply good; be good for something." - Henry David Thoreau
"Don't wish it were easier. Wish you were better." - Jim Rohn
"My interest is in the future because I am going to spend the rest of my life there." - Charles Kettering
"Discontent is the first step in the progress of a man or a nation." - Oscar Wilde
"To lose patience is to lose the battle." - Mahatma Gandhi
"Any fool can criticise, complain, condemn, and most fools do." - Anonymous
"Pull the string, and it will follow wherever you wish. Push it, and it will go nowhere at all." - Dwight Eisenhower
"Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life." - Confucius
"Unless you try to do something beyond what you have already mastered, you will never grow." - Ralph Waldo Emerson
"I don't know why we are here, but I'm pretty sure that it is not in order to enjoy ourselves." - Ludwig Wittgenstein
"Make each day your masterpiece." - John Wooden
"Not failure, but low aim, is a crime." - James Russell Lowell
"At the centre of your being you have the answer; you know who you are and you know what you want." - Lao Tsu
"Create your future from your future, not from your past." - Werner Erhard
"I think of life as a good book. The further you get into it, the more it begins to make sense." - Harold S. Kushner
"The teacher is like the candle which lights others in consuming itself." - Giovanni Ruffini
"Don't cry because it's over. Smile because it happened." - Dr. Seuss
"Don't let someone else's opinion of you become your reality." - Les Brown
"Our doubts are traitors, and make us lose the good we oft might win, by fearing to attempt." - Shakespeare
"Conquer your bad habits or they will conquer you." - Rob Gilbert
"There is nothing impossible to him who will try." - Alexander the Great
"There is never a better measure of what a person is than what he does when he's absolutely free to choose." - William M. Bulger
"A leader has the vision and conviction that a dream can be achieved. He inspires the power and energy to get it done." - Ralph Lauren
"Early to bed and early to rise makes a man healthy, wealthy, and wise." - Benjamin Franklin
"I always like to look on the optimistic side of life, but I am realistic enough to know that life is a complex matter." - Walt Disney
"The only time you mustn't fail is the last time you try." - Charles F. Kettering
"The journey is the reward." - Chinese Proverb
"Anyone who angers you conquers you." - Elizabeth Kenny
"You must do the thing you think you cannot do." - Eleanor Roosevelt
"A person is a success if they get up in the morning and gets to bed at night and in between does what he wants to do." - Bob Dylan
"You can do it if you believe you can!" - Napoleon Hill
"Change will not come if we wait for some other person or some other time." - Barack Obama
"Life has no limitations, except e ones you make." - Les Brown
"Anyone who keeps the ability to see beauty never grows old." - Franz Kafka
"Strong, deeply rooted desire is the starting point of all achievement." - Napoleon Hill
"Problems are only opportunities with thorns on them." - Hugh Miller
"Even a mistake may turn out to be the one thing necessary to a worthwhile achievement." - Henry Ford
"Be as smart as you can, but remember that it is always better to be wise than to be smart." - Alan Alda
"Every exit is an entry somewhere else." -Tom Stoppard
"Forget the times of your distress, but never forget what they taught you." - Herbert Gesser
"An ant on the move does more than a dozing ox." - Lao Tzu
"Nothing will ever be attempted if all possible objections must first be overcome." - Samuel Johnson
"Our life is frittered away by detail. Simplify, simplify." - Henry David Thoreau
"Don't wait. The time will never be just right." - Napoleon Hill
"The secret of success in life is for a man to be ready for his opportunity when it comes." - Benjamin Disraeli
"Let yourself be silently drawn by the stronger pull of what you really love." - Rumi
"It is unwise to be too sure of one's own wisdom." - Mahatma Gandhi
"To be wronged is nothing unless you continue to remember it." - Confucius
"Circumstances do not make the man, they reveal him." - James Allen
"I began learning long ago that those who are happiest are those who do the most for others." - Booker T. Washington
"The measure of a man is the way he bears up under misfortune." - Plutarch
"Perfection is achieved, not when there is nothing more to add, but when there is nothing left to take away." - Antoine de Saint Exupery
"The future depends on what we do in the present." - Mahatma Gandhi
"Need and struggle are what excite and inspire us." - William James
"A fool despises good counsel, but a wise man takes it to heart." - Confucius
"You can stand tall without standing on someone. You can be a victor without having victims." - Harriet Woods
"The man with insight enough to admit his limitations comes nearest to perfection." - Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
"If people believe in themselves, it's amazing what they can accomplish." - Sam Walton
"What do we live for, if it is not to make life less difficult for each other?" - George Eliot
"Life is either daring adventure or nothing." - Helen Keller
"You'll miss the best things if you keep your eyes shut." - Dr. Seuss
"No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." - Eleanor Roosevelt
"We must travel in the direction of our fear." - John Berryman
"If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." - Mark Twain
"Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one." - Albert Einstein
"We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit." - Aristotle
"Desire is the starting point of all achievement." - Napoleon Hill
"Anything's possible if you've got enough nerve." - J.K. Rowling
"Success is the sum of small efforts, repeated day in and day out." - Robert Collier
"Like what you do. If you don't like it, do something else." - Paul Harvey
"When we accept tough jobs as a challenge and wade into them with joy and enthusiasm, miracles can happen." - Arland Gilbert
"Ever tried. Ever failed. No matter. Try Again. Fail again. Fail better." - Samuel Beckett
"Experience is a hard teacher because she gives the test first, the lesson afterwards." - Vernon Law
"The most beautiful thing we can experience is the mysterious. It is the source of all true art and science." - Albert Einstein
"It does not matter how slowly you go so long as you do not stop." - Confucius
"Success is neither magical nor mysterious. Success is the natural consequence of consistently applying the basic fundamentals." - Jim Rohn
"When you are content to be simply yourself and don't compare or compete, everybody will respect you." - Lao Tsu
"Discontent is the first necessity of progress." - Thomas Edison
"What is important is not what happens to us, but how we respond to what happens to us." - Jean-Paul Sartre
"The ultimate reason for setting goals is to entice you to become the person it takes to achieve them." - Jim Rohn
"The greatest compliment that was ever paid me was when someone asked me what I thought, and attended to my answer." - Henry David Thoreau
"He who talks more is sooner exhausted."- Lao Tsu
"When you want something, you have to be willing to pay your dues." - Les Brown
"Think and wonder, wonder and think." - Dr. Seuss
"The significant problems of our time cannot be solved by the same level of thinking that created them." - Albert Einstein
"Love what you do. Do what you love." - Wayne Dyer
"Your worth consists in what you are and not in what you have." - Thomas A. Edison
"The challenge is not to manage time, but to manage ourselves." - Steven Covey
"When we seek to discover the best in others, we somehow bring out the best in ourselves." - William Arthur Ward
"What the mind of man can conceive and believe, it can achieve." - Napoleon Hill
"Not all of us can do great things. But we can do small things with great love." - Mother Teresa
"Common sense is the collection of prejudices acquired by age eighteen." - Albert Einstein
"One machine can do the work of fifty ordinary men. No machine can do the work of one extraordinary man." - Elbert Hubbard
"Our duty as men is to proceed as if limits to our ability did not exist." - Teilhard de Chardin
"Keeping score of old scores and scars, getting even and one-upping, always makes you less than you are." - Malcolm Forbes
"Patience is the companion of wisdom." - St. Augustine
"Be the change that you want to see in the world." - Mahatma Gandhi
"Deal with the world the way it is, not the way you wish it was." - John Chambers
